If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits you is destroyed after dealing damage. You can eat through 2-inch thick, nonmagical wood or metal in 1 round.
  • You can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
  • You can make a melee attack with a reach of 5 ft. that deals [[/damage formula=1d6+@abilities.str.mod bludgeoning average]] plus [[/damage 4d8 acid average]] damage. In addition, nonmagical armor worn by the target is partly dissolved and takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

Treant Form.name: Treant Form
Treant Form.description:
Starting at 14th level, you can take on the form of the grandest creature of the forest, the treant. You can use your Wild Shape to transform into a @Compendium[dnd5e.monsters.NB6wUgVqeOQtsQKu]{Treant}, but must follow all other limitations presented under Wild Shape.

You cannot use the Animate Trees ability of the treant.

Dragon’s Tongue.name: Dragon’s Tongue
Dragon’s Tongue.description: Starting at 1st level, you can speak, read, and write Draconic. Additionally, whenever you make a Charisma ability check when interacting with dragons, your proficiency bonus is doubled if it applies to the check.

Darkness Domain.name: Darkness Domain
Darkness Domain.description: The clerics of the Darkness Within are secretive individuals who detach themselves from society and keep to the shadows. They accommodate themselves to darkness and operate unseen, focusing on hiding what they deem significant from the eyes of those who seek them. The imprint of the Dark Star’s reign still resonates with the populace of Aglarion, manifesting in the subconscious memory of the society as a whole. Those who follow the Darkness Within keep their faith to themselves even if they are not devoted to the ideology of the dark solar avatar of their dualistic god. They pray at midnight and venerate the new moon as the absolute peak of their god’s power.

Universal Language.name: Universal Language
Universal Language.description: Starting at 6th level, you become able to converse with anyone alive or dead. You are constantly under the effect of a @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.gopnZvS0c2jD5FP8]{Tongues} spell and you can cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.I2LUSF5ogc7Bj62e]{Speak with Dead}, @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.aL1F8fvYLtNzUbKu]{Speak with Animals}, @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.2VXGS206tuChoeXy]{Speak with Plants} spell each a number of times per day equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once) without using spell slots or material components. Your spells that require your target to hear you can affect any creature type that has an Intelligence ability score of 3 or higher even if that creature is immune to being @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.zZaEBrKkr66OWJvD]{charmed} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.oreoyaFKnvZCrgij]{frightened}.

Hybrid Form.name: Hybrid Form
Hybrid Form.description:
Starting at 6th level, you can assume the form of a lycanthrope hybrid. As an action, you can spend 1 sorcery point to transform into a hybrid form for 1 minute and gain the following benefits:

  • When you aren’t wearing armor, your AC equals [[12+@abilities.dex.mod]].
  • You gain damage resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons.
  • You become proficient with natural weapons.
  • Your hands transform into claws that deal [[/damage formula=1d6+@abilities.str.mod slashing average]] damage. You can attack twice with your claws, instead of once, whenever you take the attack action on your turn.
  • As a bonus action, you can make a bite attack that deals [[/damage formula=1d8+@abilities.str.mod piercing average]] damage.

Hybrid Form.name: Hybrid Form
Hybrid Form.description:
While in hybrid form, you have :

  • When you aren’t wearing armor, your AC equals 12 + your Dexterity modifier (so [[12+@abilities.dex.mod]]).
  • You gain damage resistance to &Reference[bludgeoning], &Reference[piercing], and &Reference[slashing] damage from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons.
  • You become proficient with natural weapons.
  • Your hands transform into claws that deal [[/damage formula=1d6+@abilities.str.mod slashing average]] damage. You can attack twice with your claws, instead of once, whenever you take the attack action on your turn.
  • As a bonus action, you can make a bite attack that deals [[/damage formula=1d8+@abilities.str.mod piercing average]] damage.

Read Thoughts.name: Read Thoughts
Read Thoughts.description: Starting at 13th level, as an action you can read the surface thoughts of one creature within 60 feet of you. The effect can penetrate barriers, but 3 feet of wood or dirt, 2 feet of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it. While the target is in range, you can continue reading its thoughts, as long as your concentration isn’t broken (as if concentrating on a spell). While reading the target’s mind, you have advantage on Wisdom (&Reference[ins]) and Charisma (&Reference[dec], &Reference[itm], and &Reference[per]) skill checks against the target.

Dragon Wings.name: Dragon Wings
Dragon Wings.description: Starting at 14th level, you gain the ability to sprout a pair of dragon wings from your back, gaining a fly speed equal to your current speed. You can create these wings as a bonus action on your turn. They last until you dismiss them as a bonus action on your turn. You can’t manifest your wings while wearing armor unless the armor is made to accommodate them, and clothing not made to accommodate your wings might be destroyed when you manifest them.

Efficient Spell Recovery.name: Efficient Spell Recovery
Efficient Spell Recovery.description: Starting at 2nd level, you have learned to recall spells more efficiently by remembering their key variables. You can recover an additional spell slot when using your arcane recovery class ability.

Predator’s Knowledge.name: Predator’s Knowledge
Predator’s Knowledge.description: Starting at 1st level, your bestial side awakens, giving you the skills of predators. You gain proficiency in the Dexterity (&Reference[ste]), Wisdom (&Reference[prc]), and Wisdom (&Reference[sur]) skills if you are not already proficient in them.

Spycraft.name: Spycraft
Spycraft.description: Starting at 3rd level, you become a master of spycraft. You gain proficiency with the Dexterity (&Reference[ste]), Dexterity (&Reference[slt]), and Charisma (&Reference[dec]) skills if you are not already proficient in them or double your proficiency bonus if you are already proficient in them.

Empowered Glyph.name: Empowered Glyph
Empowered Glyph.description: Starting at 6th level, you can inscribe the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.pB7XVYwdGNcUG935]{gyph of warding} spell in an instant and make it more potent. You can cast the glyph of warding spell as an action without using a spell slot and reroll a number of the damage dice equal to [[max(1,@abilities.int.mod)]] when using the spell’s explosive runes option. You must use the new rolls. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it until you finish a long rest.

Forceful Communal Prayers.name: Forceful Communal Prayers
Forceful Communal Prayers.description: Starting at 17th level, you can make spells more potent if you or others cast the same spell in your presence. After you or an ally casts a spell, creatures targeted by the same spell cast by you or an ally gain disadvantage on the saving throw until the end of the turn. Additionally, if the spell requires a dice roll, you or allies can reroll 1s and 2s and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2.

The Great Pretender.name: The Great Pretender
The Great Pretender.description: Starting at 14th level, you can pretend to be someone else by projecting a visage of your pure imagination, while you remain invisible. As an action, you can expend one use of your Bardic Inspiration to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.MBMaQLwoy05qzMJ3]{mislead} without using a spell slot or material components.

Dedicated Defender.name: Dedicated Defender
Dedicated Defender.description: Starting at 7th level, you can deflect attacks against those whom you protect. When another creature damages you or your ally within 5 feet with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage by [[/r 1d6+@abilities.cha.mod]] points. This reduction increases to [[/r 1d8+@abilities.cha.mod]] at 13th level, and [[/r 1d10+@abilities.cha.mod]] at 17th level.

Ooze Form: Attack.name: Ooze Form: Attack
Ooze Form: Attack.description:
While in Ooze form, you can make a melee attack with a reach of 5 ft. that deals [[/damage formula=1d6+@abilities.str.mod bludgeoning average]] plus [[/damage 4d8 acid average]] acid damage.

In addition, nonmagical armor worn by the target is partly dissolved and takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

Channel Divinity: Vow of Protection.name: Channel Divinity: Vow of Protection
Channel Divinity: Vow of Protection.description: You can use your Channel Divinity to bolster your defenses. As a bonus action, you can utter a vow of protection from a creature you can see within 30 feet of you, using your Channel Divinity. That creature gains disadvantage on attack rolls against you for 1 minute or until you drop to 0 hit points or fall unconscious.

Channel Divinity - Vow of Protection.name: Channel Divinity - Vow of Protection
Channel Divinity - Vow of Protection.description: You have disadvantage on attack rolls against the caster of this spell for 1 minute.

Practiced Abjurer.name: Practiced Abjurer
Practiced Abjurer.description: Starting at 2nd level, you become practiced at learning &Reference[abjuration]{abjuration} spells. The gold and time you must spend to copy an abjuration spell into your spellbook is halved.

Dark Sight.name: Dark Sight
Dark Sight.description: Starting at 1st level, you gain darkvision 60 ft. and magical darkness doesn’t impede your sight. If you already have darkvision, its range increases by 60 ft.

Commander.name: Commander
Commander.description: Giving orders is second nature to a commander. These exemplary fighters lead their squadrons by inspiring their subordinates and bolstering their fighting prowess through the strength of their voices and their presence. As a result, the forces under their command can achieve incredible feats of battle, even when odds are stacked against them.

Sneaky Interrupt.name: Sneaky Interrupt
Sneaky Interrupt.description: Starting at 3rd level, your understanding of magic theories equals that of a trained wizard and as such, you know when it’s best to strike at them. You gain proficiency in the Arcana skill if you aren’t already proficient in it and gain an advantage on your attack rolls against targets maintaining concentration on a spell.

Intimidating Slaughter.name: Intimidating Slaughter
Intimidating Slaughter.description:
Starting at 14th level, the fear in the eyes of your enemies intensifies your combat prowess. As a bonus action, you can make a melee weapon attack against a &Reference[frightened apply=false]{frightened} creature and your melee weapon attacks score a critical hit against them on a roll of 18, 19 or 20.

On a critical hit, all hostile creatures within 30 feet who saw your critical hit must succeed on a [[/save wis dc=@abilities.cha.dc]] saving throw (DC equals 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Charisma modifer) or become frightened until the end of your next turn.

Ethereal Passage.name: Ethereal Passage
Ethereal Passage.description: Starting at 14th level, you gain the ability to traverse the Ethereal plane. You can cast @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.PQuEgKyCdovOvhqN]{etherealness} without using a spell slot. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

Expanded Spell List: Witchservant.name: Expanded Spell List: Witchservant
Expanded Spell List: Witchservant.description:
Expanded Spell List. At 1st level, your hag patron lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you:

Witchservant Expanded Spells

Warlock Level

Spells

1st

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.95K2aUhAGV9qXjnf]{bane}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.BQk5Row4NymMnUQl]{hideous laughter}

2nd

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.zwGsAv6kmwzYGhh3]{blindness/deafness}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.hJ6ZiA3fpoY8v9cp]{darkvision}

3rd

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.pO4zGe5LmFIYqJiL]{bestow curse}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.NXWWWgHtWb7Nv21F]{tiny hut}

4th

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XqzXSKNR75ZdYTA9]{divination}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.04nMsTWkIFvkbXlY]{polymorph}

5th

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.d54VDyFulD9xxY7J]{commune}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.CjIq8Ed7bu3vVwT1]{contagion}

Curse of Silver.name: Curse of Silver
Curse of Silver.description: Starting at 14th level, the curse coursing in your veins manifests, giving you enhanced invulnerability. You gain damage resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons.

Heightened Primordial Magic.name: Heightened Primordial Magic
Heightened Primordial Magic.description: Starting at 14th level, your element-based spells become harder to resist. When you cast a spell that deals acid, cold, fire, lightning, radiant, or thunder damage and forces a creature to make a saving throw to resist the effects of the spell, you can spend 3 sorcery points to give all targets of the spell disadvantage on their first saving throw made against the spell.

Brawn Over Magic.name: Brawn Over Magic
Brawn Over Magic.description: Starting at 10th level, you can tense your muscles and stiffen your body to with-stand the effects of magic. When you become the target of a spell or magical effect that requires a saving throw, you may choose to make a Strength saving throw instead of the original required save. In addition, if the spell or magical effect would allow you to make a saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw and only half damage if you fail. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it until you finish a short or long rest.

utility.condition: Having to do a saving throw

Shadow Conjuration.name: Shadow Conjuration
Shadow Conjuration.description: Starting at 14th level, you can create a quasi-real creature made out of shadows. As an action, you can cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.1LkZvINag7KqBmDR]{conjure elemental} spell without expending a spell slot or material components, but instead of conjuring an elemental, you can create an illusory creature of challenge rating 6 or lower of any type. A creature that uses its action to examine the illusory creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/save int dc=@abilities.int.dc]] saving throw. If a creature discerns the illusory creature for what it is, the creature can see through the image and takes only half damage from the illusory creature, and has advantage on saving throws and ability checks made against the illusory creature. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it until you finish a long rest.

Pseudo Reality.name: Pseudo Reality
Pseudo Reality.description: Starting at 6th level, you can empower your illusions with quasi-real shadows that deal damage. When you cast a 1st or higher level spell to create the image of an object, creature, or visible phenomenon, you can choose to cast your spell to deal [[/damage 1d6 psychic average]] demage per spell level every turn to those creatures that are affected by it. Affected creatures can make an [[/save int dc=@abilities.int.dc]] saving throw to halve the damage. Physical interaction with the image does not reveal it to be an illusion. A creature that successfully disbelieves the image by taking an action to make a successful Intelligence (&Reference[inv]) skill check becomes immune to the damage dealt by the spell.

Channel Divinity: Darkness Descends.name: Channel Divinity: Darkness Descends
Channel Divinity: Darkness Descends.description: Starting at 2nd level, as an action, you can use your Channel Divinity to harness darkness, summoning darkness and banishing light. As an action, you present your holy symbol and summon a 30 foot radius globe of darkness that functions as the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.S7VbUetIfVT7B6Eq]{Darkness} spell that lasts for 1 minute. The globe appears in a space that you can see within 30 feet of you. Any magical light effect within the globe is dispelled. Additionally, each hostile creature within the globe must make a [[/save con dc=@abilities.wis.dc format=long]] when the globe of darkness appears. A creature takes [[/damage formula=2d6+@classes.cleric.levels necrotic average]] damage on a failed saving throw, and half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that has total cover from you is unaffected.

Hybrid Form: Claws.name: Hybrid Form: Claws
Hybrid Form: Claws.description:
Your hands transform into claws that deal [[/damage formula=1d6+@abilities.str.mod slashing average]] damage. You can attack twice with your claws, instead of once, whenever you take the attack action on your turn.

Note: The claws can't only be used whern in hybrid form.

Primordial Physiology.name: Primordial Physiology
Primordial Physiology.description: Starting at 1st level, your anatomy resembles that of an elemental, making you less vulnerable to elements and certain conditions that affect the body. You gain advantage on saving throws against being &Reference[petrified apply=false]{petrified} or &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned}. You also gain a damage threshold of 2 against acid, cold, fire, lightning, radiant, and thunder damage.

Monstrous Aspect: Claws of the Griffon.name: Monstrous Aspect: Claws of the Griffon
Monstrous Aspect: Claws of the Griffon.description:
While using the Claws of the Griffon option of @UUID[Compendium.crown-of-the-oathbreaker.player-options.Item.TzN0DBd5mOiDE8rY]{Monstrous aspect}, your hands turn into savage claws like those of a griffon.

You can use your attack action to make a claw attack that deals [[/damage formula=2d4+@abilities.str.mod slashing average]] damage.

Oath Spells: Oath of Protection.name: Oath Spells: Oath of Protection
Oath Spells: Oath of Protection.description:
Oath of Protection Spells

Paladin Level

Spells

3rd

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.xmDBqZhRVrtLP8h2]{Protection from Evil and Good}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.jZ6JNykRtdQ90MOo]{Shield of Faith}

5th

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.MAxM77CDUu8dgIRQ]{Protection from Poison}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.JVhKeanAXZH62DrF]{Warding Bond}

9th

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.y8A4HfTwd93ypdEz]{Magic Circle}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.j8NtLXOOJ3GAKF8I]{Protection from Energy}

13th

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.VtCXMdyM6mAdIJZb]{Death Ward}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.TgHsuhNasPbhu8MO]{Guardian of Faith}

17th

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.TkJ8Wtg1L7TZtspm]{Dispel Evil and Good}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.AGFMPAmuzwWO6Dfz]{Raise Dead}

Raging Defiance.name: Raging Defiance
Raging Defiance.description: Starting at 3rd level, you can shake off and overcome magical effects with ease. While raging, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

Conjure Abomination.name: Conjure Abomination
Conjure Abomination.description: Starting at 14th level, the otherworldly beings you venerate allow you to summon their more powerful servants. As an action, you can cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.XT7nzJmVGgv73uaf]{Conjure Celestial} spell without expending a spell slot or material components, but instead of a celestial creature, you conjure an aberration type creature of your choice within the limits of the spell. The spell lasts 1 hour and doesn’t require you to concentrate on it. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it until you finish a long rest.

Pretender.name: Pretender
Pretender.description: Not every bard in Aglarion is trained in the College of Minstrels. Some of them learn their trade on the streets by picking up survival techniques that allow them to manipulate their enemies by utilizing techniques of make-believe. A Pretender is a bard who uses talents with words and swords to fool everyone. They are always at home in social situations where they can draw attention to themselves and manipulate people’s choices and viewpoints according to their will. They also excel in com-bat, where they utilize the same tactics of distraction and feint, which they also use when speaking.

Monster Friend.name: Monster Friend
Monster Friend.description: Starting at 14th level, monstrosities sense your connection to their kind and become hesitant to attack you. When a monstrosity wants to attack you, that creature must make a [[/save wis dc=@abilities.wis.dc format=long]]. On a failed save, the creature must choose a different target, or the attack automatically misses. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this effect for 24 hours. The creature is aware of this effect before it makes its attack against you.

Lycanthropic Bloodline.name: Lycanthropic Bloodline
Lycanthropic Bloodline.description: Some descendants of lycanthropes can awaken the power of their ancestors and benefit from the curse that runs in their blood. These individuals become more and more bestial as their dormant heritage slowly awakens, which they sometimes find hard to control. Lycanthropic bloodline sorcerers rely on their newfound natural savagery in combat and benefit from the defensive capabilities of their ancestors.

Bestial Affinity.name: Bestial Affinity
Bestial Affinity.description: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your body language and soothing sounds to calm animals and monsters. You gain advantage on Wisdom (&Reference[animal handling]{animal handling}) checks made to calm &Reference[beast]{beasts} and &Reference[monstrosity]{monstrosities} with an Intelligence score of 3 or lower.

Mettle.name: Mettle
Mettle.description: Starting at 15th level, you become skilled in resisting several types of threats. Choose two abilities in which you don’t have a saving throw proficiency. You gain proficiency in saving throws made with the chosen abilities.

Sprite Companion.name: Sprite Companion
Sprite Companion.description: Starting at 7th level, the Feyrealm blesses you with a faithful @Compendium[dnd5e.monsters.MUpBNDoJEr09bLaO]{Sprite} companion. The sprite acts on its own and has its own will, but it is always loyal to you. It disappears if it reaches 0 hit points but a new sprite arrives the next dawn to replace the previous one.

Fey Reinforcements.name: Fey Reinforcements
Fey Reinforcements.description: Starting at 11th level, you can call fey creatures to help you. You can cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.yN3XZZujhR4aVvPa]{Conjure Fey} spell without expending a spell slot or material components. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

Manifest Aberrant Trait.name: Manifest Aberrant Trait
Manifest Aberrant Trait.description: Starting at 6th level, you can call forth specific powers of your revered entities. As an action, you can expend one use of your Wild Shape feature to emulate one special trait of any aberration type creature of CR 3 or lower for one minute. If there is a saving throw associated with the special trait then the DC equals [[8+@prof+@abilities.wis.mod]].

Channel Divinity: Cleansing Lay on Hands.name: Channel Divinity: Cleansing Lay on Hands
Channel Divinity: Cleansing Lay on Hands.description: You can use your Channel Divinity to empower your @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.classfeatures.Item.OdrvL3afwLOPeuYZ]{Lay on Hands} ability. By extending one use of your Channel Divinity, you can cure multiple diseases and neutralize multiple @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.lq3TRI6ZlED8ABMx]{poisons} with a single use of Lay on Hands without expending hit points separately for each affliction. This use of your Lay on Hands also functions against negative influences that include being &Reference[charmed apply=false]{charmed}, cursed, or &Reference[frightened apply=false]{frightened}.

Keen Senses.name: Keen Senses
Keen Senses.description: Starting at 1st level, your senses become sharper, similar to that of a predator. You gain advantage on Wisdom (&Reference[prc]) skill checks that rely on sight, hearing, or smell.

Stonefist.name: Stonefist
Stonefist.description: A small monastery of the Stonefists exists in the Shandar Mountains, which is related to some unspeakable horrors of legend that supposedly lurk on the top of the highest peaks. The monks of the Stonefist practice the fighting techniques of earth elementals by studying and imitating their combat maneuvers. Their daily practice involves hardening their bodies to withstand blows and the rigorous focusing of their strength. Masters of this monastic tradition become almost impervious to non-magical attacks and reach a level of ascendance where they can turn themselves into earth elementals.

Divert Strike.name: Divert Strike
Divert Strike.description: Starting at 18th level, you become one with your weapon, being able to deflect melee attacks. As a reaction, you can negate a melee attack made by a creature within 5 feet of you. You must make a melee attack roll contest against the melee attack roll of the creature. On a success, you negate all damage from the creature’s attack.

Primordial Energy Savant.name: Primordial Energy Savant
Primordial Energy Savant.description: The bloodline of the ancient primordial elementals runs in only a few creatures on the Material Plane. These creatures are partially composed of the elements that make up the fabric of all worlds, making them less vulnerable to energy effects. Primordial energy savants are conduits of elemental power who can nurture their heritage to an extent where they can freely access all of the elements to imbue their spells. At the peak of their power, the connection of these elemental-infused creatures on the Elemental Planes is so strong that they can tear a gateway to them using their sheer forces of will.

Resist Lure.name: Resist Lure
Resist Lure.description: Starting at 3rd level, you learn how to resist being &Reference[charmed apply=false]{charmed}. You gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed.

Magical Siege Beast Companion.name: Magical Siege Beast Companion
Magical Siege Beast Companion.description:
Starting at 11th level, the maximum challenge rating of the &Reference[beast]{beast} that you can have as your companion increases to 3 and can be of Huge size.

Your beast companion’s natural attacks count as magical for the purposes of overcoming damage resistance.

Ooze Domain Spells.name: Ooze Domain Spells
Ooze Domain Spells.description:
Ooze Domain Spells

Cleric Level

Spells

1st

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.a3XtAO5n2GrqiAh5]{Create or Destroy Water}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.7e3QXF10hLNDEdr6]{False Life}

3rd

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.4H6YgYdKgnX6ZQ8M]{Acid Arrow}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.zwGsAv6kmwzYGhh3]{Blindness/Deafness}

5th

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.64uo4fHriHLjRUrX]{Meld into Stone}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.j8NtLXOOJ3GAKF8I]{Protection from Energy}

7th

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.DGONTFbk5eORs5qv]{Black Tentacles}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.da0a1t2FqaTjRZGT]{Freedom of Movement}

9th

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.CjIq8Ed7bu3vVwT1]{Contagion}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.l9Ju5KE7bbn3WpTm]{Hold Monster}

Mercenary.name: Mercenary
Mercenary.description: Those who offer their martial skills for hire face various challenges with each mission. Their most essential skills are surviving any threat, standing their ground in any situation they face, and overcoming their foes. A good mercenary is always prepared for the unexpected and will creatively improvise a solution to meet the requirements of the battle. Most of the large mercenary companies operate out of the Drayl City States where this type of warfare based on swords-for-hire has long-established traditions.

Umbral Stalker.name: Umbral Stalker
Umbral Stalker.description: Those who spend their lives in darkness become part of it. The umbral stalker lives in the shadows and strikes unexpectedly. These rogues train to become part of the darkness they live in and to use it to the best of their advantage. Soon, its essence starts to seep into their very beings. Umbral stalkers eventually become able to open a rift into the Shadowrealm and learn to move between the planes, feeling at home in the shadows of both realms.

Draconic Ancestry.name: Draconic Ancestry
Draconic Ancestry.description:
Starting at 6th level, you become dragonlike in your nature. You gain the Draconic Ancestry, and associated Breath Weapon and Damage Resistance traits of the @Compendium[dnd5e.races.K4DNDcR6vngbp0pf]{Dragonborn} race.

Note Foundry: You can find the breath weapons in the SRD Race Compendium.

Versatile Fighting Style.name: Versatile Fighting Style
Versatile Fighting Style.description:
Starting at 10th level, you become experienced with all kinds of weapons and fighting styles. You can swiftly change your style of fighting to fit the challenge temporarily. You can’t benefit from the same Fighting Style option more than once. Choose one of the following options at the beginning of your turn:

  • @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.classfeatures.Item.8YwPFv3UAPjWVDNf]{Archery}. You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.
  • @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.classfeatures.Item.zSlV0O2rQMdoq6pB]{Defense}. While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.
  • @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.classfeatures.Item.hCop9uJrWhF1QPb4]{Dueling}. When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.
  • @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.classfeatures.Item.3Nc6u9pyStByuJsm]{Great Weapon Fighting}. When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.

Void Eye.name: Void Eye
Void Eye.description: Starting at 8th level, you gain blindsight 30 ft. and become immune to the blinded condition.

Fear Rager.name: Fear Rager
Fear Rager.description: Taking advantage of one’s weakness is a crucial tactic in combat. These barbarians learn how to instill fear in their enemies and exploit their opponents’ hesitation when facing a raging menace. The disregard and disdain these barbarians feel for those who fear them gives them an extra surge of power as if they would feed on the fear they create. Many of the Vordani war tribes use this tactic to overcome their foes.

Apex Predator.name: Apex Predator
Apex Predator.description:
Starting at 18th level, you become an apex lycanthropic predator infused with magic. When using your Hybrid Form class feature, you gain the following additional benefits:

  • When you aren’t wearing armor, your AC equals 13 + your Dexterity modifier.
  • Your claw damage increases to [[/damage formula=2d4+@abilities.str.mod slashing average]] points of slashing damage.
  • Your bite damage increases to [[/damage formula=2d6+@abilities.str.mod piercing average]] points of piercing damage.
  • You gain an additional attack action on each of your turns.
How to setup

You need to update the damages for your to hybrid forms attacks.

  • Hybrid Form: Claws: Edit the attack on your character sheet, in the inventory tab. In the detail tab, modify the damage formula and change the 1d6 to 2d4
  • Hybrid Form: Bite: Do the same for but change the 1d8 to 2d6

Culling the Weak.name: Culling the Weak
Culling the Weak.description: Starting at 10th level, you can take advantage of those who fear you. You gain advantage on melee attack rolls against &Reference[frightened apply=false]{frightened} creatures and your melee weapon attacks score a critical hit against them on a roll of 19 or 20.

Coordinated Shot.name: Coordinated Shot
Coordinated Shot.description: Starting at 10th level, you can spot the exact moment to release a shot while your ally occupies your target. Once per turn, you gain advantage on your first ranged attack roll against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn’t &Reference[incapacitated apply=false]{incapacitated}.

Agile Tentacles.name: Agile Tentacles
Agile Tentacles.description: Starting at 14th level, you sprout appendages in the form of two fully functional alien tentacles that spread disease. You gain additional tentacle limbs that you can use to manipulate objects within a reach of 5 feet. You are considered to be proficient with these tentacles when making unarmed attacks with them. You can attack with both tentacles as part of a bonus action. Each hit with a tentacle causes 1d6 points of bludgoning damage + your Strength modifier. A creature hit by a tentacle must make a [[/save con dc=@abilities.con.dc]] saving throw (DC equals 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Constitution modifier) or become diseased. A creature diseased this way gains disadvantage on its attack rolls and ability checks for 1 minute.

Agile Tentacles.name: Agile Tentacles
Agile Tentacles.description: You are diseased. While diseased, you have disadvantage on your attaks and ability checks.

Chaos Wielder.name: Chaos Wielder
Chaos Wielder.description: Chaos Wielders choose the Elemental Chaos as their patron, allowing them to tap into the raw forces of chaos and manipulate fate itself. In their temperaments, these warlocks often resemble the force they serve - they are erratic and sometimes even nihilistic, not bound by any standards of laws or social norms. As a result, Chaos Wielders are usually spurned by the rest of society and are considered dangerous in their seemingly incomprehensible motives.

Painful Incantation.name: Painful Incantation
Painful Incantation.description: Starting at 6th level, you can cause intense pain with your damaging spells. As a bonus action, you can choose to use painful incantation when you roll damage for a spell and force the damaged creature to make a [[/save con dc=@abilities.cha.dc]] saving throw. On a failed save, the target creature’s speed is halved, it has disadvantage on attacks, skill checks, Strength and Dexterity saving throws for 1 minute, and if the target tries to cast a spell during this time, it must first succeed on a Constitution saving throw or the casting fails and the spell is wasted. A target suffering from this pain can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the pain ends. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

Bastion of Self.name: Bastion of Self
Bastion of Self.description: Starting at 15th level, your faith makes you protected against your foes. Any creature who targets you with an attack or a harmful spell must first make a [[/save wis dc=@abilities.cha.dc]] saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. Any creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to Bastion of Self for 24 hours. This effect doesn’t protect you from area effects, such as the explosion of a fireball. This effect also ends if you are &Reference[incapacitated apply=false]{incapacitated} or die.

Inheritor of the Unbegotten.name: Inheritor of the Unbegotten
Inheritor of the Unbegotten.description: The drow of House Ausstyl, one of the ancient drow houses of the Feyrealm, have venerated otherworldly abominations since the dawn of time. The druidic tradition of the aberration worshiping dark elves of the Dark Below includes merging one’s body with unspeakable, indescribable beings that have penetrated reality from beyond time and space. The Inheritors of the Unbegotten are not just aberrant creatures themselves, but they are also vital instruments and gatekeepers of the horrors they worship.

Wild Magic.name: Wild Magic
Wild Magic.description: Starting at 1st level, your spells can have unforeseen consequences. You can choose to apply a Wild Magic Surge effect immediately after you cast the spell. Roll for a random effect on the Wild Magic Surge table on page 104 of the Player’s Handbook. You can use this feature a number of times equal to half your warlock levels rounded down, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Order of Defense.name: Order of Defense
Order of Defense.description: Starting at 10th level, you can expend one use of your Commander’s Order ability to allow the creatures you choose to gain and roll the Commander’s dice and add the number rolled to one saving throw.

Channel Divinity: Mass Aid.name: Channel Divinity: Mass Aid
Channel Divinity: Mass Aid.description:
Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to bolster your allies with toughness and resolve. As an action, you present your holy symbol and evoke healing energy that increases the hit point maximums and current hit points by your proficiency bonus x 5 for eight hours for all creatures you choose within 30 feet of you. This trait has no effect on undead or constructs.

Note on how to use

When using this Channel Divinity option, it's important to use it's features in the right order:

  1. Add the "Channel Divinity: Mass Aid" effect on the targets. This will raise their HP max

  2. Use the Healing button on the targets.

Academic Wizard.name: Academic Wizard
Academic Wizard.description: Academic wizards are highly trained in all forms of schools of magic and are specialized in the methodology and procedures of spellcasting itself. They analyze the structure of spell formulas in great detail to optimize them and to be able to handle them with greater ease than other mages. Their understanding of these basic concepts allows them to interchange spells in a versatile, almost effortless way. Academic wizards are only trained in the Arcane Tower in the kingdom of Aglarion, where they master their trade for long years before leaving the academy.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: Starting at 14th level, you become naturally resilient towards harmful magic. You gain advantage on all saving throws against spells and magical effects. You also gain the effects of a @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.Szvk5FEVQW3uhJi5]{Haste} spell for three rounds when you successfully save against a harmful spell or magical effect.

College of Dirge Singers.name: College of Dirge Singers
College of Dirge Singers.description: The college of dirge singers was formed from the ancient funeral singers of the Inevitable, the god of Death. These pious servants of the clergy of death were able to project the feelings associated with their chosen faith through songs and poems so powerfully that they could influence the emotions of others and even kill them. The followers of the Inevitable still imitate the secret songs and poems of the original dirge singers, but only the most skilled singers can invoke their true magical powers.

Order of Attack.name: Order of Attack
Order of Attack.description: Starting at 15th level, you can expend one use of your Commander’s Orders ability to allow the creatures you choose to gain and roll the Commander’s dice and add the number rolled to one attack roll.

Oath of Cleansing.name: Oath of Cleansing
Oath of Cleansing.description: Paladins who swear this oath dedicate their lives to purify themselves, others, and places from malign influences. They are paragons of cleanliness, both in their dwellings, places of worship, private quarters, and persons. These paladins are often found engaged in rooting out malevolent forces, whether they be diseases or poisons. They are commonly found in places of healing, sometimes accompanying armies as medics, and rarely on personal quests to cleanse places or people from harm.

Monster Tamer Magic.name: Monster Tamer Magic
Monster Tamer Magic.description:
You learn an additional spell of 1st level or higher when you reach certain lev-els in this class, as shown in the Monster Tamer Spell List table. Each spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn’t count against the number of ranger spells you know.

Monster Tamer Spell List

Ranger Level

Spells

3rd

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.aL1F8fvYLtNzUbKu]{Speak with Animals}

5th

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Iv2qqSAT7OkXKPFx]{Locate Animals or Plants}

9th

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.1Drt0SHxbEAHxprN]{Conjure Animals}

13th

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.LrPvWHBPmiMQQsKB]{Dominate Beast}

17th

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.l9Ju5KE7bbn3WpTm]{Hold Monster}

Feyfriend.name: Feyfriend
Feyfriend.description: Those who venture into the forests deep enough might find crossroads that connect the Feyrealm and the Material Plane. Often, mischievous fey dwell around these planar breaches, and if one can express the right attitude, they can be befriended. The fey respect those who understand their nature and are willing to become life-long allies over time. In Aglarion, feyfriend rangers have horrific stories to tell about the recent hardships of the few fey who have fled the Bleak Mire. Even with the crossroads blocked to this domain, the Feyrealm itself still helps these allied rangers upkeep their valued alliances.

Iron Will.name: Iron Will
Iron Will.description: Starting at 3rd level, you become focused and confident. You gain advantage on saving throws against being &Reference[charmed apply=false]{charmed} and &Reference[frightened apply=false]{frightened}.

Battle Feint.name: Battle Feint
Battle Feint.description: Starting at 3rd level, you can fool your enemies with your sudden swordplay and movement, placing them in a precarious combat situation. As a bonus action, you can expend one use of your Bardic Inspiration on your turn to feint, choosing one creature within 5 feet of you as your target. Your target must succeed on a Wisdom (&Reference[Insight]) skill check against your Charisma (&Reference[Deception]) skill check. If you win the contest, you have advantage on your melee attack rolls against that creature and the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of your next turn.

One with the Shadows.name: One with the Shadows
One with the Shadows.description: Starting at 9th level, you can blend into &Reference[darkness]{darkness}, making your movement almost undetectable. While under the cover of darkness, you can use your Sneak Attack feature and have advantage on Dexterity (&Reference[ste]) skill checks.

Speak with Plants.name: Speak with Plants
Speak with Plants.description: Starting at 2nd level, you gain the ability to converse with plants. You can cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.2VXGS206tuChoeXy]{Speak with Plants} spell without expending a spell slot or material components. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Bone Claw.name: Bone Claw
Bone Claw.description: Starting at 3rd level, sharp, curved bone appendages grows out of both of your forearms that you can use to make attacks. The bone claws have a reach of 5 feet, can be used as part of an unarmed attack, and deal 1d8 + Strength modifier slashing damage on a hit.

Expanded Spell List: Dragon Patron.name: Expanded Spell List: Dragon Patron
Expanded Spell List: Dragon Patron.description:
At 1st level, your Great Wyrm patron lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you:

Dragon Patron Expanded Spells

Spell Level

Spells

1st

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.pub0OWVEB71XQx1n]{feather fall}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.0xmXiPiuYws1OGcX]{hunter's mark}

2nd

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.hJ6ZiA3fpoY8v9cp]{darkvision}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.9eOZDBImVKxbeOyZ]{enhance ability}

3rd

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.cg50KpBkBdPK6vPL]{clairvoyance}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Szvk5FEVQW3uhJi5]{haste}

4th

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.da0a1t2FqaTjRZGT]{freedom of movement}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ReMbjfeOKoSj3O79]{stoneskin}

5th

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.JQyigMNPiDnGI18b]{geas}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.W4Qx5z0id6da0vqg]{legend lore}

Combined Spell Effects.name: Combined Spell Effects
Combined Spell Effects.description: Starting at 14th level, you learn how to apply spells so that their effects are combined. You can apply and stack the same magical effect of a spell to a target one additional time. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it until you finish a long rest.

Tenets of Cleansing.name: Tenets of Cleansing
Tenets of Cleansing.description:
The tenets of the Oath of Cleansing offer a framework for paladins of this order to keep all aspects of their lives and those of others pristine and devoid of harmful effects.

Cleanse the domain. Your surroundings reflect upon your person. Keep them spotless so that you may benefit from their immaculate nature and the purity they provide.

Cleanse the body. Your body is the shrine of your being. A healthy body is the first step to a healthy mind and soul.

Cleanse the mind. Keep your mind sharp and without filthy thoughts. Avoid substances that cloud your intellect and strive to keep it sharp.

Cleanse the soul. The soul is divine and must be protected from external influences. By righteous actions, you can fortify it and keep it unsullied.

Spy.name: Spy
Spy.description: Spies are masters of infiltration and stealth, able to get out of seemingly impossible situations with the intelligence they seek. They train their memories to remember even the most minute details at a glance, making them valuable agents to recover information. Spies are adept at avoiding notice when needed, pocketing valuable objects or intelligence, and deceiving whoever they encounter with expertly woven cover stories. Some masters of their trade can even pierce the minds of their marks, allowing them to more effectively infiltrate the ranks of organizations they target.

Alert on Duty.name: Alert on Duty
Alert on Duty.description: Starting at 3rd level, you can focus your attention to notice movement. Designate a 10 square foot area. If you stay in this area for 10 minutes, you can double your proficiency bonus and gain advantage on Wisdom (&Reference[perception]) skill check made to notice creatures.

Discern Falsehood.name: Discern Falsehood
Discern Falsehood.description:
Starting at 7th level, you can focus your senses to detect deliberate lies. As an action, you can target one creature within 30 feet. The target creature must make a [[/save cha dc=@abilities.cha.dc]] saving throw. On a failed save, you know if the target creature deliberately and knowingly speaks a lie.

The spell does not reveal the truth. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Ultimate Conviction.name: Ultimate Conviction
Ultimate Conviction.description: Starting at 20th level, you can imprison, interrogate, and punish those you find guilty. As an action, you can create a cell made out of energy similar to a @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.Y7uWUO4yqUN0JKl0]{forcecage} spell. Any creature within the cell must make a [[/save cha dc=@abilities.cha.dc]] saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is &Reference[charmed]{charmed}. Creatures charmed this way must answer your questions truthfully while they are imprisoned this way. You can choose to release the target from the cell at any time, or target one of the creatures within the cell with an @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ZVnL9L8v1KC9TBF4]{imprisonment} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.dmvaMLFWFtv0qx0S]{power word kill} spell as if you have cast it requiring no material components. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

Acid Resistance.name: Acid Resistance
Acid Resistance.description: Starting at 6th level, you gain resistance to acid damage.

Ready For Anything.name: Ready For Anything
Ready For Anything.description: Starting at 7th level, you learn to be prepared for the unexpected. You can’t be surprised while you are conscious. You can take an action to gain advantage on your next saving throw. You lose this advantage at the end of your turn.

Prevent Escape.name: Prevent Escape
Prevent Escape.description:
Starting at 15th level, you are able to prevent your enemies from escaping. As an action, you can target one creature within 30 feet. The target creature must make a [[/save cha dc=@abilities.cha.dc]] saving throw. On a failed save, the target creature becomes &Reference[restrained] by an invisible force and is prevented from using any form of teleportation, dimensional, or planar travel for one minute.

Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Oath Spells: Oath of Cleansing.name: Oath Spells: Oath of Cleansing
Oath Spells: Oath of Cleansing.description:
Oath of Cleansing Spells

Paladin Level

Spells

3rd

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.xmDBqZhRVrtLP8h2]{Protection from Evil and Good}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Kn7K5PtYUJAKZTTp]{Purify Food and Drink}

5th

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.F0GsG0SJzsIOacwV]{Lesser Restoration}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.MAxM77CDUu8dgIRQ]{Protection from Poison}

9th

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.j8NtLXOOJ3GAKF8I]{Protection from Energy}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XZhdgVK3cLoxNCQl]{Remove Curse}

13th

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.VtCXMdyM6mAdIJZb]{Death Ward}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.da0a1t2FqaTjRZGT]{Freedom of Movement}

17th

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.TkJ8Wtg1L7TZtspm]{Dispel Evil and Good}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WzvJ7G3cqvIubsLk]{Greater Restoration}

Purify.name: Purify
Purify.description: Starting at 15th level, you can remove any negative condition from yourself or a willing creature you touch as an action. This ability also includes madness, &Reference[petrified apply=false]{petrification}, and polymorph effects in addition to diseases and &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisons}, as well as being &Reference[charmed apply=false]{charmed}, cursed, &Reference[frightened apply=false]{frightened}. You can use this feature [[max(1,@abilities.cha.mod)]] times. You regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Flows of Chaos.name: Flows of Chaos
Flows of Chaos.description:
Starting at 6th level, you can manipulate fate using the power of chaos. When any creature makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can use your reaction to roll [[/r 1d4]] and apply the number rolled as a bonus or penalty to the creature’s roll. You can do so after the creature rolls but before any effects of the roll occur.

At 10th level, this dice increases to [[/r 1d6]], and at 14th level this dice increases to [[/r 1d8]]. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus (so [[@prof]]), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Get The Job Done.name: Get The Job Done
Get The Job Done.description: Starting at 18th level, you can overcome threats with ease. Instead of rolling, you can choose to succeed on a saving throw automatically. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it until you finish a short or long rest.
